generif.text: YEAF1/RYBP and YAF-2 are functionally distinct members of a cofactor family for the YY1 and E4TF1/hGABP transcription factors.
interacts specifically with the E2F2 and E2F3 family members, dependent on the marked box domain in these proteins
Apoptin is efficiently delivered and induced apoptosis in cancer cells when fused to the HIV-TAT protein transduction domain.
DEDAF associates with a DED-containing DNA-binding protein in the nucleus and regulates the transcription activity [DEDAF human]

Adenovirus expressing Rybp synergistically cooperates with the death receptor ligand, tumor necrosis factor-alpha, in the induction of apoptosis, and thus may have clinical applicability for the treatment of cancer.
RYBP interacts with MDM2 via residues 1-73 and 144-228 & decreases MDM2-mediated p53 ubiquitination, stabilizing p53 increasing its activity. RYBP is decreased in human cancer tissues.
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Polymorphisms in RYBP and AOAH genes are associated with chronic rhinosinusitis in a Chinese population.
RYBP has a role in survival of patients with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and responsiveness to chemotherapy
Results identify a novel YY1 ~ miR-9 ~ RYBP axis involved in melanoma tumorigenesis and reinforce the idea that regulatory circuitries involving miRNAs and TFs are prevalent mechanisms.
RYBP activates FANK1-mediated activator protein 1 (AP-1) signaling pathway which contributes to tumor cell apoptosis.
overexpression of RYBP suppresses breast cancer growth and metastasis both in vitro and in vivo.
This study revealed the molecular mechanism responsible for RYBP nuclear translocation.
findings support the idea that RYBP may represent a target for cancer therapy and suggest that it may be useful as a prognostic biomarker for HCC, either alone or in combination with KLF4 and Sp1

this is the first study to show the correlation between RYBP polymorphisms with the risk and prognosis of HCC. We found that the RYBP SNP, rs2118593 can be a new predictor for poor prognosis of HCC, providing a scientific basis for improving the treatment and prognosis of HCC.
This review also discusses the role of RYBP in apoptosis through non-epigenetic mechanisms as well as recent investigations linking the role of RYBP to apoptosis and cancer.

Mechanistic dissection further disclosed that RYBP directly binds to ubiquitin protein ligase E3A (UBE3A) to promote its ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation in an autoubiquitination-independent manner

upregulation of RYBP decreased the phosphorylation of EGFR and ERK1/2 in anaplastic thyroid cancer (ATC) cells. Taken together, our data indicated that RYBP might be considered as a promising therapeutic target for the treatment of ATC.

ETS1 up-regulates human RYBP expression at transcriptional level.  ETS1 binds to RYBP promoter region through a multiple of conserved ETS1 binding sites in RYBP promoter region. RYBP is required for ETS1-induced human tumor cell growth inhibition.
RYBP expression level in tumor tissues was applied to predict the prognosis of hepatocellular carcinoma patients more accurately
the up-regulated expression of miR-769-5p contributed to Hepatocellular carcinoma progression possibly by targeting RYBP.
RYBP suppresses esophageal squamous cell carcinoma proliferation by downregulating CDC6 and CDC45, thus inhibiting the G1-S transition
Upregulated miR4115p levels promote lymph node metastasis by targeting RYBP in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
The nuclear localization sequence of the epigenetic factor RYBP binds to human importin alpha3.
Re-expression of circ_0043610 contributes to trophoblast dysfunction through the miR-558/RYBP pathway in preeclampsia.
RYBP Sensitizes Cancer Cells to PARP Inhibitors by Regulating ATM Activity.
Deficiency of the Polycomb Protein RYBP and TET Methylcytosine Oxidases Promotes Extensive CpG Island Hypermethylation and Malignant Transformation.
Structural basis of the histone ubiquitination read-write mechanism of RYBP-PRC1.
Glucose-induced RYBP suppresses tumor cell aerobic glycolysis and migration.

BP.term: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
negative regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process

name: RING1 and YY1 binding protein

reactome.name: RUNX1 interacts with co-factors whose precise effect on RUNX1 targets is not known

summary: Predicted to enable DNA binding activity and transcription coregulator activity. Involved in several processes, including histone H2A monoubiquitination; negative regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process; and positive regulation of transcription, DNA-templated. Located in nucleoplasm. Colocalizes with PcG protein complex. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
